clinical_study.brief_title: The Association of Gut Microbiota With Urinary Tract Infection in Infants
clinical_study.official_title: The Association of Gut Microbiota With Urinary Tract Infection in Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

clinical_study.source: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective case-control study will compare the gut microbiota between the infants with febrile urinary tract infection and healthy infants.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that the gut environment reflected by intestinal microbiota influences the risk of urinary tract infection. This prospective case-control study will compare the gut microbiota between the infants with febrile urinary tract infection and healthy infants. The investigators will sequence the V3-V4 of the bacterial 16SrRNA genes from the feces and analyze the sequencing data by QIIME2.

primary_outcome.measure: The differential compositional analysis of the gut microbiota between healthy controls and infants with febrile urinary tract infection.
primary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 1 year, after the completion of recruitment.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will sequence the V3-V4 of the bacterial 16SrRNA genes from the feces and analyze the sequencing data by QIIME2. From the OTU table, the investigators will conduct the differential compositional analysis of the gut microbiota between healthy controls and infants with febrile urinary tract infection, using the linear discriminant analysis and analysis of differential abundance taking sample variation into account in R program and QIIME2.

secondary_outcome.measure: The differential functional analysis of the gut microbiota between healthy controls and infants with febrile urinary tract infection.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 1 year, after the completion of recruitment.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will predict the functional analysis from the OTU table and compare those results between healthy controls and infants with febrile urinary tract infection, using PICRUST2 analysis.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infants with febrile urinary tract infection
arm_group.description: The investigators will recruit infants hospitalized for acute febrile urinary tract infection. Before starting antibiotics treatment, The investigators will collect feces with the informed consents from infants' parents.
The investigators will recruit healthy controls from the clinics for routine check up with the informed consents from infants' parents.

intervention.description: When the infants will be diagnosed with urinary tract infection, feces will be collected. Feces will be collected from healthy infants with informed consent.
intervention.arm_group_label: Infants with febrile urinary tract infection

biospec_descr.textblock: The investigators will sequence the V3-V4 of the bacterial 16SrRNA genes from the feces.

study_pop.textblock: Infants hospitalized for febrile urinary tract infection. Healthy controls who visited at primary care clinic for routine check up with informed consent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of febrile urinary tract infection.
- Infants
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital kidney disease
- Congenital heart disease
- Other metabolic disease
